alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 5:32AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Chena River Upstream of the Moose Creek Dam * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas such as parking lots, boat launches, picnic areas and campgrounds in the Chena River Recreation area. Low lying roads and driveways near the Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek Dam may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 AM AKDT, Heavy rain that fell over the Upper Chena River Monday through early Wednesday is causing high water and minor flooding on the Upper Chena River. The river gauge at the the Mile 38 Bridge on Chena Hot Springs Road is at 20.45 feet and rising slowly. It is expected that the river will crest at the Mile 38 bridge later this morning and cause minor flooding of low lying areas of the Chena Rec Area. This crest of high water and minor flooding will move downstream to the Hunts Creek area this afternoon, and to the Moose Creek Dam late tonight or early Friday. - Parking areas, low lying roads, and boat ramps will be flooded. Gravel bars will be under water. Logs and debris will float down the river. - - For Chena River near Two Rivers: At 5:00am the stage was 20.45 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People along the Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek Dam should prepare for minor flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
